clues.text: We swear, suborning this--getting a witness to lie on the stand in court--is also a felony, as the indictment says
Whether you stole drugs, diamonds or dirt bikes, theft of more than $500 worth of stuff is "grand" this
You may say there is one against you, but you had an agreement with 2 others to commit a crime, so you're charged with this
You didn't whisk anyone off or ask for ransom, but as O.J. found in 2008, keeping someone from leaving can also be this crime
So not nice you did it twice! Your bogus signature & also endorsement on that draft is double this
The title of M. Scott Peck's self-help book "The Road Less Traveled" has caused many to misquote this poet
The first line of this ancient poet's "Aeneid" inspired George Bernard Shaw's play title "Arms and the Man"
The best-laid plans of these 2 authors gave us 1785's "To a Mouse" & the 1937 title inspired by it, "Of Mice and Men"
F. Scott Fitzgerald's last complete novel; its 4-word title is taken from "Ode to a Nightingale" by John Keats
"Humpty-Dumpty" gave this Robert Penn Warren novel about a Southern politician its title

rounds.category: WE USED TO MAKE THAT CAR

clues.text: The DeVille & the Seville
The Prelude, 1978 to 2001
The LeBaron & the Sebring
The Karmann Ghia, 1955 to 1974
The Bearcat, introduced in 1912
Above ground anemone blanda makes fields of pretty flowers; below, it produces these growths, like potatoes
Sea anemones' tentacles have nematocysts that inject poison to do this to prey, which is a lot easier to kill afterwards
Sea anemones can split in 2, a form of reproduction called longitudinal this, also a physics term
Very tricky, clown fish; you & the sea anemone protect each other in this arrangement, from the Greek for "live together"
Greek myth says red anemones popped up from the blood of this really good-lookin' youth after his death
In 1988 Glenn Tropf of Holy Cross set a single-season record by making 63.4% of these long shots
This Tar Heel hit a championship winner vs. the Hoyas in 1982; in 2013 he was named an all-time March Madness player
Lonzo Ball, a star for this college team, didn't have far to travel for his pro job when the Lakers took him in the 2017 draft
In 2014 both the men's & women's teams from this university located in the small town of Storrs won basketball titles
This Spokane, Wa. Jesuit school made its first appearance in the NCAA final game in 2017, but came up a tad short
Nebraska's state seal has a steamboat on this river with the Rocky Mountains in view
This bird feeds its young on Louisiana's seal
This item that ends up in a bed in "The Godfather" is also on New Jersey's flag & seal
8 leaves of this poi-producing plant are on Hawaii's seal
Each ray of the large star on its state seal has an emblem of one of the 5 Civilized Tribes

rounds.category: I'M JUST NOT THAT INTO YOU

clues.text: You turn your nose up at this sport that gives Calder & Lady Byng trophies, so thanks, but no thanks
I like a good glass of wine or 2; you are this type of 10-letter nondrinker
For you, it's got to be roses; I prefer this type of flower that comes in Rembrandt & Greigii varieties
I wear a suit at work; you go to the office in clothes for this activity on which Lululemon was built
You like the Jason Bourne films, while I prefer classics like this one with Humphrey Bogart as a riverboat captain
Stave 1 of "A Christmas Carol" is called his "Ghost"
This story mentions an apparition "said by some to be the ghost of a Hessian trooper"
The ghosts that live in the paths of the dead in this series must never rest until they fulfill their oath made to Isildur
A governess is convinced that the 2 children in her care see ghosts in this novella by Henry James
"The Haunting of" this title residence includes inexplicable noises & doors that shut by themselves
He wrote Berkshire Hathaway shareholders, "You only find out who is swimming naked when the tide goes out"
This comedian has 2 quotes in Bartlett's, both catchphrases: "Can we talk?" & "Who knew?"
In 1798 he told his men, "From the summit of yonder pyramids forty centuries look down upon you"
This "wish"ful line from "Brokeback Mountain" is Annie Proulx' entry in Bartlett's
clues.response: "I wish I knew how to quit you"

clues.text:
Bartlett's quotes this author:
"Mother died today, or maybe it was yesterday"
Try not to laugh at this, the output of a currency counterfeiter
A full-length monster movie
If you're eager & fidgety, you might have this rhyming problem that mentions trousers
A heroic defender, specifically of a company facing a hostile takeover
In a farm idiom a problematic situation is a "tough" one
A demilitarized zone 2 1/2 miles wide by 150 miles long separates these 2 nations
This capital city once had a Mayor Ahmadinejad
A tall bit of business, this mountain got its name from being the second peak measured in the Karakoram range
Among the principal tributaries of this river are the Xiang, the Han & the Yalung
One of the lands that lock in this landlocked country is Myanmar, to its west
His widow Elizabeth was lobbying Congress for a Little Bighorn museum when she died in 1933 at 90
The author of "Wife No. 19, or the Story of a Life in Bondage" had the satisfaction of outliving this Mormon by 40 years
In Feb. 2009 the former Maria Elena Santiago, married to this Texan musician for 6 months, marked 50 years as his widow
This president from Ohio was assassinated in 1881; his widow moved to South Pasadena, dying in 1918 aged 85
The USA's first female licensed glider pilot, she died age 94 in 2001, 26 years after her husband

rounds.text: Falsely accused of murder, a character in his 1948 novel becomes "tyrant over the whole county's white conscience"
